data.title: GraphicsDevice.ApplyChanges leads to a blank, black screen in Win8
data.body:
I have a handler which responds to Game.ApplicationViewChanged and:
1. Updates the desired back buffer width and height to match the window size
2. Applies changes

I'm finding when I call ApplyChanges the screen goes black (I'm clearing screen with CornflowerBlue so black is definitely not from me).

data.title: GraphicsDeviceManager Fixes
data.body:
This fixes the compile error that seems to have occurred from a merge earlier today.

Took the time to cleanup a bunch of unnecessary #ifdef'ing in  GraphicsDeviceManager.

data.title: develop3d- Async fix
data.body:
Windows now works correctly with threaded texture loads.
Also added required call to GL.Flush() on iOS as well.

data.title: Develop 3D Music
data.body:
Hi,

When trying to play MP3 in my iOS game, I get this error:

2012-07-31 19:12:14.995 GemFinderMT[421:1507] MPMusicPlayer: Unable to launch iPod music player server: application not found
2012-07-31 19:12:15.496 GemFinderMT[421:1507] MPMusicPlayer: Unable to launch iPod music player server: application not found
2012-07-31 19:12:15.496 GemFinderMT[421:1507] MediaPlayer: Message playbackState timed out.

My music still plays. Just wanted to give you a heads up. I am using XNB files.

data.title: When rendering to RenderTarget2D the viewport Y is wrong
data.body:
On Stable/Develop, rendering to a rendertarget with height different from BBufferHeight the viewport Y appears to be shifted up as following:

Y=rt2d.height-BBHeight

to reproduce in the rendertarget sample just change the construction of the Rendertarget as follows:

renderTarget = new RenderTarget2D (GraphicsDevice, GraphicsDevice.PresentationParameters.BackBufferWidth,
                GraphicsDevice.PresentationParameters.BackBufferHeight-50, false, SurfaceFormat.Color, DepthFormat.None);

Doggy's head will be cut off... poor doggy!

data.title: Texture2d GetData throws Not implemented exception
[WINDOWS] When loading missing Texture2D MD hangs and is unable to throw exceptions
data.body:
Strangely enought replacing

 var result = ReadAsset<T>(assetName, null);

with the actual code of the method seems to fix the issue.
This is easy to reproduce by changing the assetname of a loaded texture in 
Content.Load<Texture2D>(assetname) to any non existant filename.

data.title: [FX Compilation] Render states in FX files fail to compile
[FX Compilation] Wrong parameter name for texture
IndexOutOfRangeException in LzxDecoder
data.body:
Opening these files works just fine on the Develop branch, but when I try to load the same .xnb files in the Develop3D branch, I get an IndexOutOfRangeException in LzxDecoder at line 442. This seems to mainly occur on larger images.

Full exception: https://gist.github.com/3206239

data.title: Texture2D.FromFile fails on Linux
data.body:
I've been trying to load a Texture2D from a PNG file on disk.

``` csharp
var texture = Texture2D.FromFile(graphicsDevice, filename);
```

For some reason this doesn't seem to work

```
Stacktrace:

  at (wrapper managed-to-native) object.wrapper_native_0xb6596dd0 (int,uint*) <0xffffffff>
  at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GenTextures (int,uint&) <0x0001b>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ESTexture2D.InitWithData (intptr,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat,int,int,System.Drawing.Size,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All,bool) <0x00023>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ESTexture2D.InitWithBitmap (System.Drawing.Bitmap,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All) <0x00173>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ESTexture2D..ctor (System.Drawing.Bitmap,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All) <0x00017>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ESImage..ctor (System.Drawing.Bitmap,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All) <0x0002b>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.FromFile (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice,string,int,int) <0x000c7>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.FromFile (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice,string) <0x00017>

Any suggestions?
```

data.title: Resolution and IsMouseVisible fixes
data.body:
Hey there,
a) This implements IsMouseVisible for Windows/Linux. However, this code only works with the SVN version of OpenTK and not with the version that is currently used by MonoGame. I would really recommend updating. The old OpenTK version doesn't support ChangeResolution() either, which means that it's currently impossible to change the screen resolution (which can result in really ugly behaviour from time to time)
b) When changing resolution, IsActive was sometimes set wrong. This pull request corrects the Game.IsActive property
c) The screen resolution will now be set back to the old resolution after exiting the game. There are still some multi-monitor issues on Linux, however.

-- only pull if the OpenTK version is upgraded

How ever I cant seem to load models ,wen i try to load a model I get a long eroor message box 
it xnb I try to load ,from debug folder via the content loader like i use for the textures
does anyone have an idea whats wrong?

data.title: develop3d - Android reloads graphics assets when GL Context recreated
data.body:
Notes:
- I've tried to reuse as much code as possible. XNB decompressing has been refactored so it can be used when loading and reloading assets.
- Support for reading into existing instances added to Texture2D, SpriteFont, Model ContentTypeReader classes. I've taken the view that we only need to update the graphics resources and discard anything else when an existingInstance is supplied.
- Effect does not get reloaded through the ContentManager. Instead it caches the glsl code and recompiles that. Only glsl support added for now
- Added triggering of DeviceReset events to allow other GPU assets to be reloaded or recreated. Not sure if it's the best spot to trigger from, but it seems as good as any given current state of things. Textures loaded with Texture2D.FromStream() should be reloaded using Texture2D.Reload() in this event
- No support added for setting the IsContentLost property on DynamicVertexBuffer, DynamicIndexBuffer or RenderTarget2D
- So far only tested on Novo Tornados7 (ICS) and Samsung Galaxy II (ICS).

Happy code review,
Aranda

data.title: Develop3d - Touch orientation fix and unlock crash fix
data.body: Just submitting a couple of fixes I found recently. See commit messages.

data.title: Fix for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/628
data.body:
```
Fix for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/628
```

Need to make sure that the call to game.ResizeWindow(changed) in GraphicsDeviceManager.cs can be removed for WINRT and LINUX

data.title: PreferredBackBufferWidth/Height has no effect on Linux.
data.body:
I'm using the develop3d brach on Linux and the PreferredBackBufferWidth/Height properties have no effect on windowed mode. I also tried modifying the presentation parameters directly, with no effect.

I've been wandering through the GraphicsDeviceManager's source code and I saw it's a little messed up. I think I could do some refactor, but it has no comments and I won't be able to rewrite the cross-platform code. Anyway, I'd like to help to track down the issue.

data.title: Fixing non-Android builds
data.body: This seems to have slipped in with some touch changes today.

data.title: Added PreviousExecutionState to WinRT
data.body:
This way we can check when the app has been
terminated(ApplicationExecutionState.Terminated).

data.title: Win8 Guide
data.body:
There is no Windows 8 Guide class. I'm trying to open up the virtual keyboard but since I'm using Game class, that seems no easy/possible.
Anyone had any luck with this?

data.title: Fixed a SoundEffectInstance.Stop for Android
data.body:
Fixes a bug where the Stop command does nothing on a soundeffectinstance
Also added some null checking for the Threading.BackgroundContext to make sure we dont get a null reference exception

data.title: ContentManager and iOS Fix
data.body:
First and foremost this contains a fix to ContentManager/ContentReader.  It was incorrectly recording "disposable" assets which lead to some disposables never being freed when ContentManager.Unload() is called.  This lead to platforms like iOS eventually running out of GPU memory as SpriteFont textures were never released.  We can now run for over 24 hours without running out of memory on iOS.

The second is a fix which makes iOS compile again (a bug that has been there for a week or so).

data.title: IsMouseVisible on Linux
data.body: This setting seems to have no effect on linux.  It seems to be because OnIsMouseVisibleChanged is not implemented in LinuxGamePlatform.cs

data.title: Handling bugs in OpenTK
data.body:
Hey there,
I've noticed an ugly bug in OpenTK. Now that MonoGame does resolution changes on the display, I've noticed that this doesn't work on linux because OpenTK talks to RandR/X in the wrong way.
FIxing it isn't too hard, but I'm not sure how I should go about this in MonoGame.
Should I write a workaround in MonoGame? Or should I try to get it in OpenTK as soon as possible and run my game with a custom OpenTK version (which means that nobody else using MonoGame would get the fix)? Or should I try to get it into OpenTK and MonoGame will then use an unstable OpenTK version?

EDIT: Also: How should MonoGame handle multiple screens? Most games simply change the resolution on the primary screen and don't care about anything else, which results in a disabled second screen and a bad resolution on the primary screen. Most games then fail to set this back to normal when they exit (on Linux, that is. On Windows this is different). Should I add code to MonoGame to do this stuff correctly and also handle multiple screens in a "smart" way?
Of course, it would also be possible to use a different (i.e. unstable) version of OpenTK for Linux and keep the old version on Windows.

EDIT again: I just checked again: The bug is already fixed in the latest OpenTK svn version. So what to do? Use that on Linux? or backport the change? Personally, I'd prefere using the latest OpenTK svn version as there were many bug fixes for Linux in the last 1-2 years...

EDIT once again: A newer OpenTK version could also help implementing new features such as IsMouseVisible...
Thanks,
Adrian

data.title: Incrementing touch Id for Android.
data.body:
- Added Android/Input/Touch/AndroidTouchEventManager.cs and refactored MotionEvent handling to this class
- Removed GestureListener.cs and references
- Fixed bug in TouchPanel.cs where all subsequent events with the same Id (instead of same Id and state) were removed.
- Avoided crash when tapping during initial app load. Tried unsuccessfully to delay enabling touch (discovered SetOnTouchListener(this) was unnecessary) but ended up simply checking for null graphics device when transforming touch positions.
- Fixed bug in GraphicsDeviceManager.ResetClientBounds() and TouchPanel.cs where using an Activity attribute with "ScreenOrientation = ScreenOrientation.Unspecified" would cause TouchPanel.DisplayWidth/Height not to match current orientation.
- Massaged the way AndroidTouchEventManager is enabled/disabled to avoid (or at least minimise) Android losing touch events during screen rotation. The side effect of this was that TouchPanel.GetState() would include phantom touches that were never Released.
